## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been trying to figure out how to execute transactions on the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace. I was wondering, do I need to go through a centralized intermediary to do so?

**AI Assistant:**
No, you don't need a centralized intermediary to execute transactions on the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace. In fact, transactions are executed in a completely decentralized way, peer-to-peer, without any intermediary necessary. You can buy and sell VerusIDs and NFTs on-chain, advertising your offer directly to the owner of an ID or NFT, or posting the sale of your NFT on the worldwide blockchain for all to see.

**User:**
That sounds great! But I have another question. I've locked my VerusID with Verus Vault. Can I still spend funds from that ID?

**AI Assistant:**
No, you cannot spend funds from a VerusID that is locked with Verus Vault. When you lock your VerusID with Vault, you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. However, you can still stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn by doing so, and you can also still receive funds.

**User:**
Got it, thanks! One more question. I was trying to set up revocation, recovery, and Verus Vault capabilities, but I'm not sure if I've done it correctly. Is it possible to enable these capabilities without a primary identity and at least one revocation/recovery ID configured?

**AI Assistant:**
No, it is not possible to enable revocation, recovery, and Verus Vault capabilities without a primary identity and at least one revocation/recovery ID configured. Having one primary identity, and at least one revocation/recovery ID configured is a requirement to enable these capabilities. Make sure you have those set up correctly and you should be good to go!
How do I execute transactions on the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace through a centralized intermediary?

The Verus ID and NFT Marketplace does not require a centralized intermediary to execute transactions. In fact, transactions are executed in a completely decentralized way, peer-to-peer, without any intermediary necessary. You can buy and sell VerusIDs and NFTs on-chain, advertising your offer directly to the owner of an ID or NFT, or posting the sale of your NFT on the worldwide blockchain for all to see.

## Verus ID and NFT Marketplace
Buy and sell VerusIDs on-chain, advertising your offer directly to the owner of an ID or NFT, or posting the sale of your NFT on the worldwide blockchain for all the world to see. Execute transactions in a completely decentralized way. Pay or offer to pay from a transparent or zero-knowledge private address, still auditable by you. Accept payment to either as well, and best of all, execute your transactions directly, peer-to-peer without any intermediary necessary. Don’t worry the on-chain model still makes room for owners to select and share proceeds with value added agents, marketing organizations, or other participants in a new economy of provable digital ownership. It’s the next step in the evolution of VerusID, the most powerful self-sovereign identity and secure storage model for funds in the digital world.## Verus Vault
With Verus Vault you can now protect funds on a VerusID, even from theft of a private key! If you lock your VerusID with Vault you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. While locked, you can still stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn by doing so. Of course, you can also still receive funds.IT IS IMPORTANT TO NOTE THAT ENABLING REVOCATION, RECOVERY, AND ALL VERUS VAULT CAPABILITIES REQUIRE YOU TO HAVE ONE PRIMARY IDENTITY, AND AT LEAST ONE REVOCATION/RECOVERY ID CONFIGURED.
Can I spend funds from a VerusID that is locked with Verus Vault?

No, you cannot spend funds from a VerusID that is locked with Verus Vault. When you lock your VerusID with Vault, you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. However, you can still stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn by doing so, and you can also still receive funds.
